comment: Very kind teacher and sweet lady. Lots of assignments that give you the opportunity to bring your grade up. She uses a point based system which gives u some room to miss a few assignments here and there. However, the tests were extremely difficult and just prepare to devote SEVERAL hours a day to get a good grade in this course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: She's a great professor & gives you SO MANY resources/videos. She wants to see you pass. There's a lot of hw but it is not tedious. If you study her videos, it helps out tremendously for the tests. Try your best & it's okay to fail/miss some assignments. I missed a lot, but I did all the extra credit. I also got a D on one of the test.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I regret that I took her for accounting. She could have curved my grade 2 points and gave me a C. Her assignments are too tedious, its just an intro to accounting class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER. Aside from econ class, this was the problem class and it is clear that I should have listened to the negative reviews. She can be nice, but heavy proctoring, tough grading, confusing lectures + issues with the proctoring tool with NO ASSISTANCE from the prof cancelled out everything nice. do yourself a favor and pick someone else.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Taught me the basics of accounting with a lot of homework but she makes terrible tests. The average grade for all of her tests was failing or almost failing. I would recommend another professor for Intro accounting.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: There are so many mixed reviews on Campbell and I am honestly not sure why. It was clear to me the day I started this class that the negative reviews held more weight than the positive. This class has been miserable. I knew accounting was hard but she honestly teaches you nothing. I get left more confused after watching her example videos.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Hardest class I have ever taken in my entire life. Do everything you can to avoid taking this teacher.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a great professor that cares about you doing well. She walks around her classroom to help teach students and gives great examples. There are pop quizzes in her class that count so make sure you are in class! She responds to emails well and is very understanding! Definitely recommend her because accounting is hard, especially with a bad prof.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: Absolutely do not take this professors classes online. You learn solely through a textbook and homework. She does next to nothing when it comes to learning the material (uploaded a few videos which were helpful) and instead gives many quizzes. She believes that failing them is just how you're supposed to learn. Gives little to no feedback.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Dr.C is a really sweet professor, and she really cares about you and how well you do in the class, but her lectures are sooo boring and the homework, like the OLA's she gives out are impossible to do. She makes them so hard.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Caring

comment: she was really good at giving enough examples and worksheets to make sure you can practice plenty of times (which i highly recommend doing) she takes up some of them for a grade. she has "pop" quizzes but she usually tells you the class before that there will be a quiz. attendance wasn't mandatory but she would have random assignments for a grade

If you are taking Accounting on any level, DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR! She thinks she is making everything easy to understand, but it is not. She doesn't even use a grade Curve, and I failed every single exam. If you are with SDS and taking her class, withdraw as she doesn't seem to want to help SDS in making it easier for those students.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Gives lots of opportunities to succeed. A number of little quizzes are given in class which can easily boost your grade those few extra points. She gives the opportunity to earn more points than she actually counts. Good at breaking down concepts for you to understand clearly. Tests and her assignments don't correlate perfectly but its doable
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. C is definitely a sweet lady but she doesn't explain the difficult concepts well. She goes on and on about concepts and ideas that aren't on the test. It's one of those courses that is like shared by a bunch of professors, so the exams are standardized. Her examples aren't formatted like the test. If you can teach yourself the material, youre g
rating_tags: Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Campbell is overall a good professor. However, you MUST apply yourself. Her handouts is content and the test are how to apply the content. I strongly recommend you go to class, although it isnt required, because she gives a lot of extra points on in-class assignments.  If you dont understand something, ask her... she is a sweet person.

Professor Campbell is a very good professor who is very clear about due dates and grading criteria. However, this is a really tough class and at times I felt like she taught the class like it was a much more advanced class. She a really good job though of making sure that her students have really good handouts and example problems. Very nice prof!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: People are making professor Campbell seem to be extremely hard. Yes there are a lot of stuff you will have to print out but if you just read the 2-3 pages of notes she makes on each chapter and do the few practice worksheets you are guaranteed at least a B. Barely went to class and studied just her handouts and got an A. I would taker her again.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: You really have to study, like REALLY study, both the concepts and the applications she does in class. Personally I think that Connect was a better study tool for the exams than her 80 pages of notes. Theres only 2 test and the final. She is a really sweet professor but this is NOT a class to take if you want an easy A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--So many papers

comment: Professor Campbell is a good choice. She has worksheets that you print out and bring to class and she goes over them with you. They have examples to do and they are a big help for studying. She explains topics well and is very organized. The people who fail this class are the ones who never show up and try to get answers from a group chat.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Take this class if you love to print out a million sheets of paper. Even if you do that it's still hard to know what's going on in class. There are 3 tests, the last is cumulative. There is extra credit, you're final exam grade can replace the lowest test grade if you do 3 short assignments. She lectures the WHOLE time. I taught myself most stuff.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Gives 3 test through the semester. Gives you demos in class about the subject material and HW. The homework and stuff we go over class looks way different then what is on the test. Your way better off just teaching yourself the whole course. Be prepared to fail the first exam. She has a grade calculation sheet ready for when half the class fails.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I personally loved Professor Campbell. She is very kind and does everything she can to help you pass the class. This class is hard so make sure you do all your work and pay attention during lectures. Also I would recommend to try and not miss a lot of classes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Accounting 2100 is hard but she makes it understandable. She gives MANY opportunities for you to earn an A. Do the practice exams, homework and learn smarts and youll be fine. GO TO CLASS. she gives out little in class activities and they do add up in points so if you miss a lot youll do poor in that section.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Respected

comment: If professor campbell is teaching 1102, TAKE HER!!!! Go to class and pay attention. You will have no problem passing the class. She moves very slow and a little redundant at some times, but she makes sure that you understand every topic. She gives tons of participation points for going to class. Tests are exactly like the practice quizzes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I do not recommend this professor, I studied the textbook, took two notebooks worth of notes, and did all the assignments and killed myself for a B. Only TWO tests and the final, but the final can replace your lowest test grade if you do all the homework. She uses an online platform called Connect which SUCKS. Also a huge excel project.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She is an okay professor in the sense that she does want to help you, she just is not very clear & structured in her lectures. Because of this, most of the class consists of you teaching yourself the material. If you do take her, make sure you do ALL the homework or you will have a hard time passing. Very hard tests; didn't gives study guides.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests are tough

comment: The best teacher at KSU!!! She is very thorough and goes over all the material you need to know in great detail. You will leave her class with a lot of knowledge. She also gives a lot of handouts which are extremely helpful!!! Between her lectures and handouts you are very well equiped to do well on her exams. Eventhough the exams are challanging.

I learned a lot in this class. I want to take her class again if she offers another course. Her exams are tough because we have to show all works by hands (only10-15% of the test is multiple choice), but you won't be surprised if you prepare homework and online quizzes hard. Her power Points slides are excellent. So, just use text as a reference.

Very good professor.  A lot of work, but it is all relevant to the material and helps to learn better.  Tests are challenging, but she prepares well.  I passed my first CPA test on the first try(financial part) and the only material I did not have a problem with was all topics covered in this class. She explains very well.  Very highly recommended.
Pretty much not possible to get an A, but you will learn more from here than any other accounting professor.
Her notes are great, but she is horrible in front of the class. Just print out her notes and study all of the time. She is a tough grader as well.

Very good teacher. A lot of work for this class though. Test are long and hard,but she does prepare you for them. You cand still get points even if your final result is incorect, as long as you show your work being neat and organized. Make sure you follow her instructions. Do your homework!
You will learn alot, but watch out she grades very hard. The smallest mistake will cost you dearly. Pay VERY close attention to her instructions and follow in order.
Hardest class you will ever take!!
